com.metreeca.gate.wrappers

Class Protector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metreeca.gate.wrappers.Protector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Wrapper

    public final class Protector
extends Object
implements Wrapper
    XSS/XSRF protector.

    Enforces transport security and content security policies and manages Angular-compatible token-based XSRF protection.

      • secure

        public Protector secure(boolean secure)
        Configures strict transport security.
        Parameters:
        secure - enables strict secure transport with a default period equal to milliseconds, if true; disables it, otherwise
        Returns:
        this protector

      • secure

        public Protector secure(long secure)
        Configures strict transport security.

        If an enforced strict secure transport period is defined:

        • HTTP requests are temporarily redirected to HTTPS;
        • the Strict-Transport-Security header is set on responses with the provided max-age value, unless already defined by nested handlers;
        • XSRF cookies are created with the Secure attribute.
        Parameters:
        secure - enforced secure transport period in seconds; 0 for no secure transport enforcing
        Returns:
        this protector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if secure is less than 0

      • policy

        public Protector policy(boolean policy)
        Configures content security policy.
        Parameters:
        policy - enables content security policy with a default value equal to , if true; disables it, otherwise
        Returns:
        this protector

      • policy

        public Protector policy(String policy)
        Configures content security policy.

        If a content security policy is defined:

        • the Content-Security-Policy header is set on responses with the provided value, unless already defined by nested handlers;
        • the X-XSS-Protection header is set as a fallback measure with the value, unless already defined by nested handlers;
        • if the policy includes the default-src 'self' directive, the Referrer-Policy header is set on responses with the same-origin value, unless already defined by nested handlers.
        Parameters:
        policy - the content security policy to be enforced by the browser; empty for no policy enforcing
        Returns:
        this protector
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if policy is null

      • cookie

        public Protector cookie(boolean cookie)
        Configures cookie-based XSRF protection.
        Parameters:
        cookie - enables cookie-based XSRF protection with a default cookie lease equal to milliseconds, if true; disables it, otherwise
        Returns:
        this protector

      • cookie

        public Protector cookie(long cookie)
        Configures cookie-based XSRF protection.

        If cookie-based XSRF protection is enabled:

        • a unique XSRF token is returned in the "XSRF-TOKEN" session cookie on safe requests;
        • unsafe requests are processed only if a valid XSRF token is included both in the "XSRF-TOKEN" cookie and in the "X-XSRF-TOKEN" header and refused with a Forbidden status otherwise.

        Warning / XSRF session cookie lease time must exceed the maximum allowed session duration: no automatic XSRF cookie extension/rotation is performed until the session expires.

        Note / XSRF cookie/header names are compatible by default with Angular XSRF protection scheme.

        Parameters:
        cookie - XSRF cookie lease time in milliseconds; 0 for no cookie-based XSRF protection
        Returns:
        this protector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if cookie is less than 0

      • wrap
